description: From Middle English sunne brente, equivalent to sun +‎ burnt.

adjectives.description: sunburnt (comparative more sunburnt, superlative most sunburnt)

entries.meaning: (of human skin) Having a sunburn or dark tan; having been burned by the sun's rays.
examples: His face was sunburned bright red, and the skin of his ears was peeling.

entries.meaning: (of plants and other objects) Dried by the sun's rays.
examples: The barren Heath, and the Sun-burnt craggy Soil appear with all those Softenings to the Eye, which Distance throws upon a Landscape;

entries.meaning: (of places or objects) Subject to the strong heat and/or light of the sun.
examples: So my dear Charles, you are at length  […]  arrived in our little sun-burnt island?
The van was painted a sunburnt brown.
